definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Use your influence.It is a powerful agent for change.
sentences.chinese: 運用你的影響力，這是變化發生的強有力的原動力。

sentences.english: The crazes for high salaries are still the driving force.
sentences.chinese: 而追求高薪水也依然熱潮的原動力。

sentences.english: The fire of Kidney Yang is the original force supporting other organs' physiological activities.
sentences.chinese: 腎陽相火是其他臟腑生理活動的原動力。

sentences.english: The motivation of the creation of poetic beauty is the poet's self-expression and development.
sentences.chinese: 詩人的自我表現與張揚，是詩美創造的原動力。

sentences.english: The sexual love is the motive power of keening for life.
sentences.chinese: 性愛是人生之愛的原動力。

sentences.english: We believe community and a competitive spirit are strong motivators for exercising more and getting into better shape.
sentences.chinese: 我們相信社區和競爭精神是鍛鍊和保持身材的原動力。

sentences.english: Kylie cites motivation as the key to her success.
sentences.chinese: 雅欣將原動力視爲自己成功之道。

sentences.english: Love root itself in the sex and that's the motive force of our life.
sentences.chinese: 愛情的根永遠結在性上，這也是我們生命的原動力。

sentences.english: The heart-qi is the fundamental motive power to propel blood circulation.
sentences.chinese: 心氣是推動血液循行的原動力。

sentences.english: The hypothesis of metabolic energy supporting revealed the driving force behind the industrial fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 代謝能支撐假說揭示了工業發酵的原動力。

sentences.english: Seeking after spirit is the impulsion of development of art.
sentences.chinese: 對精神性的追求是藝術發展的原動力和支撐點。

sentences.english: Your any comments will be the driving force of our improvements.
sentences.chinese: 您的任何意見，都是宇鈞改進的原動力。

sentences.english: The second part elaborated that democracy politics is the motive power.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分闡述民主政治是總體戰的原動力。

definition: touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
to introduce into/to channel/to lead/to guide into/to import (data)
variant of 熱衷|热衷[re4 zhong1]
to learn/to acquire (some skill through practice)/acquisition
to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
modernization of agriculture, one of Deng Xiaoping's Four Modernizations
